trans-unit.source: Represents a substitute output string that is emitted when the original input byte sequence cannot be decoded.
This class cannot be inherited.
It might not be possible to convert an encoded byte sequence to an equivalent character if no suitable decoding exists.
A common reason for a decoding to fail is that the conversion operation uses a code page that cannot represent the character to decode.

If the input byte sequence cannot be converted to an output character, a <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback?displayProperty=fullName> object provides a replacement string that is substituted for the output character.

The replacement string initializes the value of the <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback> object, and the value of the <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback> object initializes the value of a <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer> object.
The value of a <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer> object is called the replacement fallback buffer.
The conversion operation uses the replacement fallback buffer to emit a replacement string instead of a decoded character, then continues to process the remainder of the input.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer"></xref> class using the value of a <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback"></xref> object that contains a replacement string.
Prepares the replacement fallback buffer to use the current replacement string.

The <xref:System.Text.Encoding.GetBytes%2A> and <xref:System.Text.Encoder.Convert%2A> methods call <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> if they encounter an unknown input byte sequence that cannot be decoded.

If the return value of <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> is `true`, the calling method can invoke the <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar%2A> method to obtain each character of the fallback buffer.
An input byte sequence.
This parameter is ignored unless an exception is thrown.
The index position of the byte in bytesUnknown.
This parameter is ignored in this operation.
`true` if the replacement string is not empty; `false` if the replacement string is empty.
This method is called again before the <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar"></xref> method has read all the characters in the replacement fallback buffer.
Retrieves the next character in the replacement fallback buffer.

The <xref:System.Text.Encoding.GetBytes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Text.Decoder.Convert%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods call <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> if they encounter an unknown surrogate pair or character in their input.

If the return value of <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> is `true`, the calling method can invoke <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar%2A> to obtain each character of the replacement fallback buffer.
The next character in the replacement fallback buffer.

Causes the next call to <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar"></xref> to access the character position in the replacement fallback buffer prior to the current character position.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.MovePrevious"></xref> operation was successful; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of characters in the replacement fallback buffer that remain to be processed.
The <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Fallback%2A> method returns `true` if the <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Remaining%2A> property is nonzero.
The number of characters in the replacement fallback buffer that have not yet been processed.
Initializes all internal state information and data in the <xref href="System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Reset%2A> method discards any persisted state information and data that govern the emitting of a replacement string.
Unpredictable results occur if the decoding operation continues after the <xref:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallbackBuffer.Reset%2A> method is invoked.
